Review.review: I developed some runners knee issues last year and just recently picked up running again. I have been looking for a good pair of supportive running shoes for a LONG time. At first, I thought the sole on these was so bizarre in the heel that I nearly returned them. However, I ended up deciding to give them a try anyway and I was SO pleasantly surprised!! I LOVE how wide the toe box is and they are very supportive. They're a little chunky because of the thick heel, but overall they're pretty light and super comfortable. Great value for quality. I've had them for a few months now and have already put quite a bit of wear on them, and they're still very comfortable. I haven't experienced any pain/blistering and they're helping my knees as I'm doing PT and getting back into my hobby. Very happy I found these!
Love these. They are very comfortable to walk in. Fit just right and the color is bright and just what I was looking for.
Great shoes. Very comfortable for walking long distances.  They have a wide toe box; which I’m always looking for.

Loved how the look and sole is very comfortable. But they squeeze the sides of my feet and feel like its holding back circulation. Already wore them a few times to the gym to try to break them in but it feels the same everytime.

These are so bulky and heavy looking. If you wear any size bigger than like an 8, I would avoid these. Even with black soles, it still looked like I had mattresses strapped to my feet. They did seem to fit true to size though.
Perfect comfort
Fiel a su talla. Suaves y la calidad del calzado adidas es excelente.
Teniendo en cuenta que se usan para caminar, son muy cómodos y acolchados

title: adidas Women's Ultradream Bold Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these shoes comfortable and well-fitting, particularly noting their suitability for wide feet. The shoes receive positive feedback for their quality, cushioning, and support, with one customer mentioning they help with knee and ankle health. Customers also appreciate their stylish appearance and consider them good value for money.

Review.review: The shoes are very comfortable with nice padding from toe to heel.  The toe area is stretchy so you can see my big toes sticking out.  I think maybe I should've gotten a half size bigger but then the heel area might have been too loose.  Wish it came in a wide width but it fits well enough.  There is room to stretch my toes out so that is a little strange looking because I'm used to having a reinforced toe area.  I'm hoping the padding holds up because it's like walking on a cloud.  I feel like I need a shoe horn to put them on or maybe loosen up the shoe strings but I manage to get them on.
Fits true to size, comfortable, and looks good for all occasions!  Not a heavy sneaker so you can wear it all day!
These shoes are great, comfortable and fit a wide foot, the only shoes I can wear to walk due to bunions...I have 2 pair.

My favorite sneakers! Like them so much I bought a second pair in a different color. Very durable, easy to wash, no foot pain!!! The soles are so soft and supportive. I walk several miles each day and my feet are finally comfortable!

I got these sneakers for my 11-year-old daughter to wear to school. They’re very lightweight and comfortable, which makes them great for all-day wear. The style is nice and clean, perfect for school uniforms. The sizing was as per the chart. The only thing to note is that the soles are a little higher than expected. Still, she likes them and they’ve been holding up well so far.

I wanted to love these but the actual shoes were made of such a stretchy mesh that they didn't feel sturdy to me. These foot bed itself was amazingly comfortable tho which is a bummer because they are probably pretty comfy. Maybe they would work if I sized down idk it just felt like my foot was moving too much with each step.

Easy to slide on and off with total security when wearing them. Literally feels like I'm walking on clouds these are by far the best shoes I have ever worn. They're stylish and comfortable, you won't regret buying them.

Really comfortable shoes. I have wide feet so I can almost always count on Adidas to be comfortable for me. I wear them a lot especially when I’m walking or going somewhere I will be walking. I was hesitant to get this color but they have stayed pretty clean for me 🙈. They are also super lightweight and bouncy like walking on clouds. The heel isn’t flat on the back it has a curve to it for walking but it doesn’t feel weird when you are standing still or anything. If anything I think it makes you evenly distribute your weight more and forces you to be more on the balls of your feet. These are the best shoes I’ve purchased in awhile as far as comfortability.

title: adidas Womens Cloudfoam Pure Sportswear SneakersSneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these sneakers comfortable, good-looking, and among the best walking shoes ever, appreciating their lightweight design. The fit and ease of putting them on receive mixed feedback - while some say they run true to size and are easy to slip on, others find them too narrow and hard to put on. The arch support and cushioning also get mixed reviews, with some praising the great arch support while others note there's not enough cushioning.

Review.review: These adidas Cloudfoam Pure sneakers have been perfect for everyday wear, offering impressive comfort thanks to the Cloudfoam cushioning that really does feel like walking on clouds. The clean, minimalist design works well with everything from workout gear to casual jeans and dresses, making them incredibly versatile for daily activities. I appreciate that they're lightweight and breathable, keeping my feet comfortable during long days of walking or standing without feeling heavy or clunky. The fit runs true to size with good arch support, and they've held up well to regular use without showing excessive wear or losing their shape. While they're not designed for serious athletic activities, they excel as comfortable lifestyle sneakers that provide the perfect balance of style, comfort, and affordability - definitely a solid choice for anyone looking for reliable everyday footwear from a trusted brand.

I absolutely love these tennis shoes!! They are the perfect style and they just look great!! The perfect tennis shoes!! They are super-comfy too!! They are very well made!! The only problem is that I don’t want to wear them to the dog park or off-roading, because I don’t want to get them dirty. Great price too! I want to buy another pair in case they stop making them!!

These sneakers are THE MOST COMFORTABLE shoes I have ever worn.I have a narrow foot with an even more narrow heel. I normally wear a 7N in my shoes. My doctor recommended these shoes to me as she said they are her “go to shoes.” She told me to order a half size up but I didn’t listen to her, I ordered a 7. They were a little too tight on my big toe so I ordered a 7.5. They fit and feel wonderful. I find myself wearing them most of the time as they provide such good support. I’ve ordered two more pairs in different colors.

These sneakers are so comfortable! The Cloudfoam Adidas are a great line of shoes! My only complaint is they are more fitted and harder to get on. You have to really loosen the shoelaces to push foot in. The loops on the back of the sneakers are too low to help. Good quality and my 3rd pair of Adidas. Fit to size!
The best shoe that I ever putted on my foot! So comfortable , so light it’s perfect for a walk I 100% recommend it!

These shoes are super comfy and stable, but a pain to put on. They look very much like handsfree/step-in shoes, but they are quite the opposite. The tab that might prove helpful if placed at the top of the back of the shoe is placed in the middle of the back where it is of no help. I actually use a shoehorn ot put them on, which may be the first time in my life that I have used one.I would actually give them a 3.5 stars if I could, as they are light and very comfortable for extended wear.
Very comfortable to walk in and very light!
So comfortable and “stylish “

Superior lightweight shoe. Surprised at the extraordinary comfort and fit. My walks of 5-6 miles/day [>150 miles so far, mostly on city streets] continue in comfort. Usually I buy size 10 3W. Adidas offers no extra-widths for these walking shoes. Still, size 10 was a very good fit, especially in the generous toe box. fwiw the price I paid in May 2025 was $67 incl tax; today its "full price" is about $80 plus tax; as always, scroll down to find Amazon's "sale price."
I got my size right , that can be hard to do online. The comfort great , fit great , I needed all black for work and good looking. Great even walking or running.

Good walking shoes, I got them to replace the laceless ones they sell that I’ve worn down so there’s a deep imprint of my foot. They’re not the highest durability, but they work for most things. I kind of miss the convenience of no laces, but overall it’s a better running/walking fit feel
Nice shoesFits to size
Love these shoes they are very comfortable and very sharp looking!!

Love these shoes. Wasn’t crazy about the color when I ordered them but knew they were comfortable and the gray and blue were in sale for nearly 50% off (compared to the others). I actually liked them more once received. Looks great and are very comfortable. Sizes are spot on and they are very lightweight. Highly recommend !
Love these shoes! Very comfortable.

title: adidas Men's Pureboost 5 Running Sneaker

Review.review: Quality is Awesome!! Color is fabulous!! Lightweight, very comfortable! Foot support, very comfortable!!

I have spent the last two weeks trying to find comfortable shoes for walking/running.  These shoes were my last chance.Immediately got relief. I went on my normal route for walking and no pain! If you’re hunting for good shoes, this is your last stop. The fit is true to size. Very happy!😊

The comfort and performance of PureBoosts, particularly when running, jogging, or walking, should not be underestimated. The sole "boost" material gives you extra bounce, and I can run on concrete without foot pain. Better than Nike Lunar and much better than lower-level Adidas like Cloudfoam. Avoid Cloudfoam. Pureboost is worth the price.

I love these shoes.The style and colors are spot on, and since I'm all in on the all-black look, I wear them almost every day to the gym. For a comfortable fit, I needed a size larger than what would be typically suggested.There are trade-offs, though. The arch support is weaker than I like, so I replace the insoles. And the inside heels come apart too soon. I've had to replace the shoes twice now.They aren't perfect, but with all their faults, they are still my favorite shoes.
Great support for my son who is on his feet all day!!
Comfortable
These are counterfeit.  I tried these on in the adidas store before purchasing and they feel completely different.

True to fit. Super comfortable! These look even better than they do in the picture. These shoes are hold up so well. My husband has them in 3 colors. This is the best price we have found any where too.

title: adidas Women's Terrex Soulstride Trail Running Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, true to size with perfect room, and appreciate their quality and durability, noting they hold up well over time. They are great for trail hiking and provide good support and stability. The cushioning receives mixed feedback, with some customers liking it while others find it lacking.

Review.review: I purchased these shoes for my daughter.  She is very happy with them and says they are very comfortable but did have a break in period of a day or two. She wore them when we were hiking and had no issues with traction on different types of terrain. They seem to be true to size and well made.  Should last her for quite a while.

Recently had twins and my old Nikes were feeling tight size 8.5 so I ordered these in a 9. These are great for trail running and although I originally did not care for the color scheme,…. These shoes feel like a dream and it made upFor not having any cute girl colors! Size 9 fits perfect in these. These are lightweight but feel like you’re being supported by a pillow cloud beneath your feet with all the support they have. I feel lighter. I love them.

For the most part these are great shoes. Quality is what you would expect from Adidas. In my opinion, that's great quality. The sole is very comfortable with lots of cushion and arch support. I think they will be great for hiking. I do not like hiking boots and prefer trail runners. These have a good mesh amount to keep your feet cool but enough solid area to keep them dry if you are dealing with minimal amounts of water. The heel is a bit bulky but provides a lot of extra support. I love the bright orange color. I always try to get bright colors for hiking gear just in case I need to be seen. The only complaint I have is that they are tad narrow. I have a narrow foot, and these are snug on me. It's not an uncomfortable amount though. They will also stretch more as I wear them in. Length wise they are true to size. I wear a 7 and these have the perfect amount of room between the tip of the shoe and the tip of my big toe. If I went a half size bigger for width they would be too long. I have another pair of Adidas I wear to the gym that I had to go half a size smaller (Adidas Swift Run). All in all, these are a great shoe and prove to me again why I always by Adidas. 4 stars because of the narrow width.

Just got them and took them out for a spin. I ordered my usual 6 and have ample toe room without sizing up. The shoes are very sturdy and supportive - hug my feet in a good way. They're cute and sporty, but no-nonsense. These replace my old shout-out Merrells (that cost twice what these cost). Good traction on dirt and gravel, too!
I bought these sneakers for my girlfriend and she loved them. They are comfortable and look great.

Wish I could return these, but they’ve been worn bc thought I’d get over how ugly they are and how weird they look on my feet but I haven’t.  (I look bow legged which isn’t a problem except I’m normally not) would especially return bc they are extremely uncomfortable even just sitting. Do not recommend.
Comfortable, breathable, easy to wear

title: adidas Men's Adizero Evo Sl M Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, lightweight, and appreciate their true-to-size fit, with one customer noting plenty of room in the toebox. The shoes receive positive feedback for their color, with one customer describing the Lucid lemon shade as "unbelievably beautiful." Customers like the cushioning and find them suitable for jogging. The stability receives mixed reviews.

Review.review: My new favorite runners! I have 6 pairs of really nice running shoes now that I will alternate between but I think these will get the preference and definitely on race day.The GOOD: The fit is perfect even though that is a bit subjective. They have very good heel support and the toe is great, with good support and springy take off! The toe box is very comfortable on my size 13 normal width (D) feet. I like the reinforced eyelets. Very good traction. The arch support is very nice too. They feel light and lively.The BAD: The shoe strings are crap and will definitely get replaced. The tongue is non-gusseted but has a loop on the tongue that allows the second and third lace to go through it and help control positioning. I prefer a gusseted tongue.These are brand new, I just got them today. Opened the box and went for a quick 5 mile run so can't speak to durability. I'm older so still very pleased with how brand new shoes already feel broken in!

Edit, 8-13-25 Updated review after wearing: After wearing these shoes for longer distances, my feet hurt. The width is good, but the toebox height is not high enough for me, and they rubbed. I must stretch these with my shoe stretcher to make them comfortable around my bunions.In the interest of not misleading anyone: The shoe tag and the Adidas box do NOT identify the shoe as a “wide” size. Also, a web search indicates, "Several reviewers specifically mentioned that the Adizero Evo SL fits well for runners with wider feet. Some even stated it's a better fit for wider feet compared to other Adidas models." That description is relative. The original web description was worded differently and it, along with Amazon’s product page, identifying the sizes as “Wide” were what I'd trusted and based my purchase on. The web search is misleading when one asks if this specific shoe model comes in “wide” and this plus Amazon’s product page are wrong! The Adidas website does not have wide sizes either. Buyer beware.In my actual wear experience and going by the shoe tag and box, these shoes are not truly “wide,” and they hurt my feet. I will notify Amazon to change the width to regular or standard, from “wide.”__________Original review: I purchased these in size 6.5 Wide in Men's sizing. Amazon was the only carrier of the Wide version at the time. My typical women's size is 7 to 7.5 extra wide. I usually need an extra wide width due to two bilateral bunions, which make my feet sensitive with any pressure. My usual shoes are Brooks and New Balance. Runrepeat gave these shoes a high rating and, after reading their research about the toe box width, toe box height, great durability, and the customer reviews from other sites, I ordered these. I dislike spending full price, but this shoe brand and style/type (+ width) have sold quickly. They are my favorite sports shoes, stable, lightweight, and are comfortably cushioned. Worth the full price, imo. (See revised review above.)
Good. True to size
This is my 2nd pair. True to size. Super comfy.
Look great, feel great, wonderful for jogging.
Excelent

Descent shoe for faster paces! Horrible stability and atrocious grip especially on turns and trails. Tongue slips terribly and laces are awful quality. Rocker feels nice even with no plate for bouncy, responsive feel. Fit ran true to size for me with plenty of room in the toebox. Can't speak on the longevity as I returned them for a different pair but I would guess the foam would not last very long for heavier runners.

I can't believe how comfortable these were, immediately! the moment i slipped them on, they hugged my feet and didn't let go until...well, i still haven't taken them off yet. eventually i will have to take a shower and get into my bed but i am definitely buying another pair before Adidas decides to discontinue or stop selling these because that's what retailers do to keep demand going. Affordable, worth every penny I paid. the color is unmistakable so when i walk at night i am definitely seen. they are very thin and lightweight material. when they came in the mail today i thought there was going to be only one shoe in there because of how lightweight the package was. too bad winter is coming soon. i live in chicago and i definitely won't be able to wear these in the snow and rain. that is the only downside. other than that, i want these shoes for the rest of my life!!

title: adidas Women's Ultraboost 1.0 Sustain Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these sneakers comfortable, fantastic, and trendy, with great arch support and a lightweight design. However, the fit receives mixed feedback - while some say it's fantastic, others find them extremely tight. Moreover, customers report issues with slip resistance, finding them hard to pull on, and experience foot pain, with multiple customers mentioning their feet hurt badly.

Review.review: LOVE these sneakers. Love Adidas products...well made, neutral balance, for those new to Ultra boost training shoes the opening is typically snug to insert the foot. I like this and I like how this shoe opening hugs the ankle. Took them out of the box and went on a 3 mile walk...super comfortable and I'm very happy with my purchase. I recommend these shoes.

The main critique folks have of these shoes is that it is hard to get them on.  These folks seem never to have heard of shoe horns.  Makes it quick and easy!  But quite difficult without one, because of the stretchy sock that helps keep your foot in place during long runs.  This shoe is most known for its comfort, and ability to give help in forward propulsion when your heel hits the ground.  The effect is not as pronounced as some Nikes, that also have a higher differential between heel height and front of shoe.  For folks accustomed to Zero naked feet flat shoes, these can be too much heellThese wash beautifully in the washing machine.  But don’t put them in the dryer.

I bought these adidas Ultraboost 1.0 sneakers specifically for a multi-day Disneyland trip, and let me just say: these shoes understood the assignment.From rope drop to fireworks, these babies carried me through 25,000 steps a day with zero blisters, zero aching arches, and zero regrets. I usually have to rotate shoes or sneak in a pair of sandals mid-day, but not this time. These Ultraboosts were light, breathable, and so ridiculously cushioned that I started referring to them as my “walking clouds.” I’m not even kidding.The Grey/White/Blue color combo is even better in person, stylish enough to match all my park outfits but subtle enough that they didn’t scream “new shoes at a theme park.” They’re sleek, cute, and made me feel like I was walking on memory foam wrapped in marshmallows.Fit-wise, they were perfect right out of the box. I didn’t even have to break them in (which is a Disneyland miracle). I wear a size 9 and found them true to size with just enough wiggle room for swelling after 12 hours on my feet.Bonus: they didn’t stain or scuff easily, even after a churro mishap and a surprise splash from Pirates of the Caribbean. Clean-up was easy, and they still look brand new.If you’re headed to the parks or just need something comfy for all-day errands, buy these. Your feet will thank you. Mine are still applauding.

Very comfortable, somewhat difficult to get over the heel but fits well once you get it.I don’t know if this is just the pair I got, but it has some weird material around the edges on the sole. Still really like them!

Feels and looks great on. I will try them out at the Chris Brown concert. I wear a 7.5 but I ordered an 8.5 and they fit great.these run small I knew it from reading the reviews. I have fat feet right now but I'd recommend you ordering one size up if you have wide feet. If I had gotten the 7.5 the shoe would fit to a T no extra room none at all. I have the pink and turquoise like these from Adidas outlet. They were so small I had to get those in 8.5 as well last year I haven't worn them yet. Order half size up not whole size they stretch out amd losses. Up after wearing

Great school shoe!  These survived the entire school year without any holes or major damage.  Huge win in my book!  My daughter liked them so much we just got a 2nd pair for her everyday sneakers.  Cute, comfy and fit true to size.
They run a lot more narrow than usual.

These are absolutely horrible. I have no idea how they get such awesome reviews from people who legit bought them and wear them regularly. Are they cute? Sure. But omg they hurt so bad. First thing I did was try them on in the house and they squeaked but I figured, eh maybe that will stop. Thankfully once there was some dirt on them, it did. They also felt a bit snug around the top of my foot but I figured eh, maybe that will loosen over time because obviously loosening up the ties does nothing on a shoe with a built in tongue. They were comfortable in all the other ways, but it did not loosen. I wore these on a trip to Las Vegas and the tops of my feet hurt SO bad by the end of day 2 of walking around. I wore sandals off and on for the rest of the trip and absolutely dreaded putting them back on for the airplane ride home. That's when I noticed my feet were legit BRUISED on top, from the weird pressure under the laces on my foot. There is no way to fix it and if it happens to you, just know that it won't loosen. You will hate these shoes that are so comfortable in every other way.I even went so far as to googling this issue, where I landed on the many Reddit threads full of other people wondering what in the world is going on with these shoes. I don't think it's just me. I have pretty small feet and I do not have high arches at all. Buy these at your own risk.

Review.review: Great sneakers. I bought two pairs different colors for my twin boys. They are excellent. Very light weight, my boys love them. No discomfort whatsoever. Fits perfectly. Great simple style. I got them for an excellent price as well. Very happy with them.
Great tennis shoe! My daughter said they are comfortable and fit well! True to size. These shoes are made well and a fantastic price!
The shoes are good for the price. The colors are cute. very comfortable. Nice quality.
Seen the same ones at a shoe store for a lot more money. Fit great. Size is perfect and color is wonderful as my son only wears black. Toes could easily be destroyed
Cute, comfortable and teen approved.
Good quality, fair price.
My son said this are very comfortable and true to size. Made very sturdy for kids, with great style.
Exactly as described! Perfect size and how it looks. I use them for walking (Yes, I do big kids size lol) I have an older pair but needed new ones & this ones were perfect.

title: adidas Women's Adizero Boston 12 Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes to be well-made and comfortable, with good cushioning and light weight. They appreciate the support, with one customer noting they feel like they're being propelled forward, and another mentioning they're great for daily training for marathons. The shoes are versatile, working well for both fast and slow running paces.

Review.review: As a midfoot striker, I needed a stiffer trainer with solid energy return. I got exactly that with these, and they survived well past 500 miles through easy runs, tempo workouts, and long runs. They fit the best for tempos and workouts, although the soles may be a tad too stiff for people who prefer a little more cushioning. These also weigh in nice and light; likely getting the newer gens as time goes as a preferred tempo trainer.
Excelente producto

Adidas has done a great job with this shoes! I am floored on the energy return, the overall comfortableness, and overall grip/durability of these shoes! For a non-carbon plated shoes, these definitely feels like they have one. I've done long runs (10 miles or more) in these shoes as well as 5k races, and they are amazing. I used to be a Nike Vaporfly fan, but due to a past injury that keeps flaring up, I couldn't wear them anymore, and so I decided to give these a shot, and boy they felt amazing. Plus, they don't give me that 'hot shoe' foot feel (nor blisters) after my runs unlike my Nike Vaporfly ones. Really happy with these shoes. Only down side though is the sizing. I'm usually a 10 for Adidas (I have their boost, their yeezy, their stans, you name it) but this is the first time I have to size half up, so I got the 10.5 ones, and they fit perfect.
This is a very aggressive shoe for a fast pace.Great cushion and amazing force return.Sizes run a little on the large size (about 1size)
Me quedaron un poco grandes y son bastantes rígidos pero muy buena calidad de materiales
Got the men’s size one size down for female. Great shoes

Wow. It’s all I can say to summarize. WHY did no one ever tell me about this shoe? Why is it not top of all these YouTubers lists?I have gone through so many shoes. Lightweight ones, max cushion, racers, and let me tell you if I could start over and have 1 shoe, THIS is it.I didn’t even notice this shoe on my 8 mile long slow run at 11:00/mile easy pace. It zoomed right on during 4:30/mile pace strides. It handled my 8:00 tempo pace with ease. Everything about this shoe executes without complication. It is simply seamless.I don’t mean to glaze, I’m just genuinely so impressed.This is a firmer shoe. If you weigh 110lbs I don’t know that you’ll like it. As an average 175lb guy, this is money. It has a lot of bounce with the foam and the rods (used instead of a plate). The continental outsole grip is insane and super planted. Very stable as well.The upper is not perfect. I need a runners loop to get a semi decent heel lock down. Not a deal breaker, everything else is 10/10.If someone asked me what shoe do I buy for all of my runs I’d tell them this. New runner? This. First 5K, 10K or half shoe? This. Long run shoe? This. Daily? You get the idea lol.I’m about to order like 2 more of these.
In love with these shoes

These shoes absolutely rock! I love all the colors that they come in and they perform even better than they look. I have always found that adidas has great quality and the size fits very true. These shoes are also nice and lightweight which puts a nice amount of speed in my stride, while minimizing the fatigue. I could wear these all day
I work in a semiconductor fab and walk  at least 6miles per day.  Paired with "Darn Tough" socks my feet feel great all day.

Comfortable shoes., wide and does not cramp my foot. I like wearing them. I would have given it 5 stars but the insole seems narrow and there  is a seam next to the heel that I can feel sometimes.

over 2 years later and they are still in decent shape!

Even after walking 10+ miles a day, these shoes were very comfortable without having broken them in beforehand. They’re roomy, true to size, supportive and easy to just slip on if you don’t feel like lacing them every time.

Light and airy feeling. Not much cushion for the insoles. Hard to get on. Good for wider feet. Not much arch support. Shoe seems like good quality. I work in a shop so I stand on cement floors 8/10 hour days and after 2 hours my feet were starting to hurt mostly in the heel area. These shoes fit well & are very comfortable. I have been spoiled by slip ons so it felt strange to have to tie them but it wasn't a big deal. They suit the purpose that I.bought them before....walking.

Seriously best running shoes ever! I LOVE the zero drop, all the cushion is in the middle and my feet don’t slide forward on impact. Great for walking and jogging breathable. Absolutely love them! I’ve already put 100 miles on them.
Beautiful color. Comfortable

These are quite possibly the ugliest issues I have ever owned, but also equally the most comfortable shoes I have ever owned. title: adidas Womens X_PLR Phase
Customer_say: Customers find these sneakers comfortable, well-made, and true to size, with one customer noting the cushioning has a "gel" padding feel. They receive positive feedback for their style, fit, and value, and customers appreciate their traction, with one mentioning they can walk in them all day. Customers disagree on whether the shoes run true to size.

Review.review: So I ordered these shoes back in late May because I needed new shoes for walking and own numerous pairs of Adidas sneakers. Well these caught my eye and were on sale for under $40 so obviously I bought them! Well when they arrived I tried them on and they literally looked like I was ready for the circus because they were so big. I wear a size 7 to a 7.5 in my fully enclosed shoes. Since I planned to wear thicker socks and a killer sale price I ordered a 7.5. Well these have to be a men’s size because they were so big but comfortable. Well I went to order a smaller size and was shocked that they were double the cost. So I returned them and ordered two other styles in 3 different sizes, only to keep one pair in a size 7. I still wanted these but at the $40 price point, so I watched and waited. While waiting, returning other pairs, and reading ALL reviews I had a better idea of the size that would probably work. Obviously the size chart wasn’t accurate and didn’t help the first time. Finally after after 2 months the price dropped and I ordered the replacement pair in a size 6.5. I tried them on and they are still a little big even with thick socks on but not bad enough for another return. A size 6 would be perfect with toe wiggle room but these will work. They are extremely padded especially around the Achilles tendon and ankle portion. The cushion almost has a “gel” padding feel and surrounds the outer part of the foot. So my other pairs of Adidas sneakers range from a 5 to a 7! This brand doesn’t seem to be consistent with size but are worth it when you find your fit. These are noticeably heavier on then most sneakers but that is do to the really thick shock absorbing sole and the padding. However it’s not heavy enough for me to give up the comfort. I have clubbed toes on my left foot and this shoe doesn’t bother me. So in conclusion I went from a 7.5 down to a 6.5 and could’ve easily worn a 6! So I would suggest sizing down at least a half size down minimal. I expect they’ll last me at least a year or more easily with this being used as a primary daily shoe. So be prepared for a possible return or wearing thicker socks. I hope this helps and good luck with your purchase!
True to size. Comfortable fit. Feels like walking on a cloud lots of cushion.
Very comfortable like walking on clouds, great price.

When I write reviews I like to be thorough so as to help people truly make an informed decision, so, here goes: The shoe is GREAT looking in person, the white color scheme I chose goes with everything, which is important to a person like me who always needs to match. The comfort of the shoe is 5 stars, it's like working out on a cloud, and I don't say that lightly. The shoe hits 5 stars for everything BUT..the sizing. It's never easy going through sizing discrepancy reviews because there's never enough detail or comparison, I'm gonna give you some. The size 10 shoe, is going for $26, 2 weeks ago, I ordered the 9.5 and it was on sale for $39. Now 9.5 is up & the size 9, only the size 10 is for $26 because the sizing is so off I'll bet they are stuck with a bunch of returns and regular inventory for that size. I got the 9.5 cheaper than it is now and I think the price went up because normal size 10 wearers grew aware of this so went for the next size down, and the one after that, driving the price up, which is my only issue with this product or seller. Shoes should be the same price across the board like they've always been but consumers are now having to pay more for the sellers not being detailed enough in their product as to write a product description that would aide consumers in choosing the right size and lowering returns & exchanges. I am normally between a 9.5 & 10 shoe size. For heels it's usually a 10, with the rare shoe still being too small. For a tennis shoe it's usually a 9.5 as a 10 is usually too big, except for the rare occasion it's just right. To give you an idea of my foot: I am 5'9, 130lbs, I am built long, bony, & muscular but my hands & feet don't have an ounce of fattie tissue on them & they don't swell. When a shoe fits, ot fits, when it doesn't, it doesnt. This shoe surprised the heck out of me because I don't remember the last time a size 9.5 sneaker felt like a 10.5. I can get away with the 9.5 because I've put a shoe insert in & I wear thick socks & the laces tie up very securely, which is another plus. My workouts are going just fine save for the stairmaster. I hate dealing with exchanges & returns so if I can make it work then I will, so thankfully, I could make due-but, I want others to know why the price discrepancy differences and what shoe size may work. If you are built bony like me but also have gunboats for feet, I would say go a full size down. Even me going to my usual 9.5, my lowest size, was barely doable, only so because I've got a good thick insole insert. If you have thicker feet, I'd say go half a size down because with this shoe it's not the width of the shoe that's the problem, the shoe cinches up & loosens great, it's the length of the shoe that's inaccurate. I still recommend this shoe, but I am a gym rat & go through sneakers like crazy so I'll get a new pair when I run through these, that's how much I love them. I hope this review helps and I hope I was detailed enough because it always bothers me when I don't know the body style of the person who is saying "too big/too small, too tall/too short", etc, because it does make a difference, for comparative purposes. It's for this lone reason that I give the shoe 4 stars instead of 5, because it was just too far off base. Hope this helps, everyone!

Review.review: I love these so far.  First day with them.From what I can tell they are an Adidas entry into the lifestyle shoe trend and borrow styling from 1970's running and track shoes.  I certainly wouldn't run with these, but as a daily wear shoes they kind of speak to, yes, I was a decent if mediocre track runner years ago and I still weekend warrior run into middle age and am doing ok with it (albeit with a separate, dedicated set of shoes).  If you flip these over the soles have circles that to me evoke the sockets that you would screw your metal track spikes into.I tried on the Adidas SL 72 RS, a more true to original lifestyle form of a once popular track shoe.  Those are tighter and maybe fit more like a pair you would lace up to run track with in school. These are a bit looser fitting, so perhaps a bit better for a daily wear.What is present on both is a canvas vinyl type material that is perhaps true to the heritage.  However, some wearers seem to not like how the material does not bend and flex along the more pliable suede overlays.  To me it's just a characteristic, but it's there.  If you're curious about how it may look after you worn the shoes take a look at photos submitted by other reviewers.But me I love these!  Love the fit, the comfort, the vibe.  It's what I was looking for.

I loosened the shoelaces hoping to give my foot more room but no matter how loose I made the shoelaces I was still left in extreme pain. Normally I do not wear a wide shoe, which is why I did not order a wide. Honestly I'm not even sure a wide would have fit me comfortably because the material up top is not very flexible at all. Review.review: I remember seeing these as a kid on my friend and some adults and thought to try them, I was a fan of Adidas as I loved the originals sneakers collection and one of my teachers had spoke about how the shoe felt like indoor cleats, I thought to finally try them.A great pair of shoes especially for the money, I probably wore these shoes over a thousand times too, to the point where there were holes and I had to get rid of them a few weeks ago. My first reaction when I got the shoes was that they were very light, at first you kind of have to break them in. They may seem a bit snug and may hurt a little bit. Perhaps it hurted me more than others because I have flat feet. After a week when you break them in, they sort of shape to your feet. It will feel comfortable and you'll feel as light as a feather, the shoes are great for athletics and they are very aesthetically pleasing, more so I liked how the shoe was rather versatile. If I wanted to wear some chinos, or some casual wear it wouldn't look to bad infact it would play the part. what I absolutely loved about these sneakers is how you can simply slip them on, I always hated those sneakers that you had to untie and worry about the shoe getting creases and what not. I however found that after a while, the shoe felt like it was slipping off and that it may have expanded during the time I was wearing, again nothing too big but it felt like it grew about 1/2 over the time I had it.  This became my go to shoe whenever I was leaving, I didn't even dare look at the others as my feet had gone through so much uncomfort when I went back. The shoe can get rather slippery in the winter and on wet areas so you need to be careful there but it's not like they're meant to be used during the winter. One of the things that I disliked about the shoe is how I had to keep on tying the laces several times, perhaps this had to with the laces mainly but I felt like it was the shoe moving from place to place as it started to expand and stretch. During the shoes last dying dies, I start to get holes from the ongoing times I've worn it, I knew it wouldn't last the way I treated it but for $40+ I didn't very much care. I later discovered that the inside of the shoes is composed of mainly some kind of cardboard, kind of surprising how such a comfortable fit could be made from such cheap material.I would recommend these to a friend, perhaps you may not want to wear them as much as I did however if you plan on making them last but it's great and with a price like that. You can't really go wrong. Would I buy them again however, there are many other shoes in the market and I'm willing to try many and see where they take me but I will have flashbacks of all the events that I had with my pair of shoes. I never begun to adore a shoe like that, no matter how much damage and dirt and stretching it went through, it managed and still had an amazing authentic look.

TL;DR: Great shoes, will mold to fit you like a glove, and last for at least a year of heavy use. Get the Samba Originals if you prefer a short tongue.About me: I'm on my fourth pair of Samba Classics. In a row. I love this shoe, and I think you will too. That being said, here's what I think you need to know:I first started wearing these shoes because I needed something with a flat sole to dance in (I did musicals in high school, and I wore straight through a pair of running shoes), and I fell completely in love with them. I wear them 100% of the time when it isn't raining and there isn't snow on the ground. I have also worn them for their "intended purpose" - indoor soccer - and find they work great there too.I would DEFINITELY recommend these shoes for serious walking, dancing, or indoor soccer. NOTE WELL: they will mold to your feet as if you were born wearing them, and will change their appearance somewhat once broken in (the leather will look a lot less shiny, and will develop a flatter fit across your foot), in my opinion much for the better. Like all leather shoes, these have a break in period, and I find it's less than a week. Once broken in, they feel AWESOME, and last a very long time: my last three pairs lasted between 1 year and 1.5 years each, depending on the amount of walking I did (walking increased when I went to college). They're also very comfortable walking / standing shoes. I've never gotten blisters or pains from them.I would NOT recommend these shoes for rain, snow, ice, hiking, or serious running. The flat sole, which makes them great for traction on flat, dry surfaces, falls short on all of these things. Since they are leather, they're fairly water resistant, and a coat of water repellent spray will make them very water resistant (and avoid winter salt water stains), but water WILL get in around the tongue, which is not attached at the sides, only at the front.These shoes tend to wear in two places: the interior heel (the back of the inside lining), which will develop holes if you're a fan of slipping your shoes on and off (which I don't recommend: these are leather, they're meant to be tied snug); and the sole, which will gradually wear toward smooth. I find that the sole and the upper wear at about the same rate: i.e. by the time the sole is worn to the point of noticeable slippage on wet surfaces, the shoes themselves look like they're ready to be replaced. If you don't care about these two factors (or you want a pair of old shoes to work in), they will basically last forever. I still use my first pair for construction, painting, and mowing the lawn. They're over four years old and the leather will probably outlast everything else in my life.These shoes are essentially identical to the Samba Originals, the difference being that these have a longer tongue. Some people don't like the tongue, which is reminiscent of soccer cleats, but I like it because it makes the shoes pop a bit more, and goes well with long casual pants, with which you can wear the tongue outside of the pants (the tongue is also not uncomfortable with shorts, especially after it gets bent forward a bit by being worn with long pants).

title: adidas Women's Ultraboost 22 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable and supportive, with great arch support and no foot aches or blisters. They appreciate the shoes' quality, appearance, and value for money, with one customer noting they're excellent for both daily runs and longer distances. The fit receives mixed feedback - while some say they fit great, others find them too tight for average feet.

Review.review: Key FeaturesBoost Midsole: Provides exceptional energy return and cushioning.Primeknit Upper: Offers a snug, sock-like fit for maximum comfort.Stretchweb Outsole: Adapts to the runner's stride for a smooth ride.Torsion System: Ensures stability and flexibility during runs.Eco-Friendly: Made with Primeblue, a high-performance recycled material.ProsComfort: The Boost midsole delivers superior cushioning and energy return.Fit: Primeknit upper offers a flexible, snug fit.Stability: Torsion system enhances stability and support.Durability: High-quality materials ensure long-lasting performance.Eco-Conscious: Made with sustainable materials.ConsPrice: Higher price point compared to other running shoes.Weight: Slightly heavier than some ultra-light running shoes.Break-In Period: May require a few runs to fully break in.Personal ExperienceThe Adidas Women's Ultraboost 22 has proven to be an excellent choice for both daily runs and longer distances. The Boost midsole provides outstanding cushioning, making each step feel energized and comfortable. The Primeknit upper fits like a glove, reducing the risk of blisters and providing excellent breathability.The shoe's stability is impressive, thanks to the Torsion system, which supports the foot without compromising flexibility. The Stretchweb outsole adapts well to my stride, offering a smooth and responsive ride.While the shoes are slightly heavier than some other running models, the comfort and support they provide outweigh this minor drawback. The eco-friendly aspect is a bonus, aligning with my values of sustainability.ConclusionThe Adidas Women's Ultraboost 22 Running Shoe is a top-tier choice for runners seeking comfort, support, and performance. Despite its higher price and slight weight, the benefits of superior cushioning, stability, and eco-conscious design make it a worthwhile investment for serious runners.

title: Under Armour Men's Charged Assert 9 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-designed, and lightweight, offering good value for money. They appreciate the fit, with one customer noting they're available in wide sizes. The durability receives mixed feedback - while some say they're holding up great, others report they wear down quickly. The sizing is also mixed, with some finding them true to size while others say they run small.

Review.review: Honestly one of the best shoes on the market for wide foot people, if your looking to snag a simple set of running sneakers, in my opinion. Here's some in-depth info along with  pro's and con's:TLDR: Great quality shoes for the price, and easy to clean. Recommend to beginner and intermediate runners/hikers, experts may be willing to pay more money for increase of quality.PROs:- Perfect Fit. I usually wear 9.0 wide (USA), so that is what I ordered and it fit perfectly.- Comfort and Ease. I like how comfortable they are and they are easy to slip on and off (if you wish) by the use of the heel pull tab. The tab also prevents the heel from getting bunched in or broken when putting on the shoes, which was a frequent problem with some other brands I have owned in the past.- Easy to Clean, Quality Mesh. I have seen some reviews saying these shoes wear out easily or the mesh is easier to damage. YMMV but I didn't seem to have this issue and I've had these shoes for about a year. IMO I find the mesh to be much more durable than the cloth mesh most sports shoes have these days and much easier to clean, which is essential for anyone like myself, who often hikes or runs in forestry/mud.- Above Average Quality. As for the year timeframe, the 1st set was about 8 months of extreme use, then I purchased a 2nd pair which I've had for about 3 months now. This may seem like a short timeframe to some but for me, I usually have to change shoes every 6 months or less if they are lower quality because they get a lot of mileage and use. I still have the 1st set which I use as "lawn mowing shoes", as they are still usable but the tread does not get much grip/traction anymore for running. I liked them enough to buy that 2nd pair instead of some other brand/model.- Decent Arch Support and Sole Tread. You will find other shoes with the same or better, but I didn't see many that were this cheap in price.- Part of Amazon's "Try Before You Buy". Free try-ons. You can take up to 6 days to decide whether to keep/return if you wish, and only be charged if not returned by the 7th day. Day 1 is the day they are delivered.- Uniform in Color. The shoe currently comes in all-black or all-white, including the logo. YMMV but this is a pro for me due to work restrictions requiring all-black shoes, so I can also wear them leisurely at work if I choose (I'm a mechanic). Great for anyone with the same issue, or military, etc.CONs:- Not the most expert/elite quality shoe out there, but will definitely check most people's boxes for average needs, imo.- Cost is higher than one might desire for just simple leisure shoes. But as an avid runner, the price is about average. However, they are usually on sale. My 1st set was around 40% off which dropped it from $70-something to $43, which was worth it for me. 2nd set was about 20% off. Winter holiday seems to be the best time for sales price.- Tread pattern is smooth and circular, instead of rigid and square/triangle, in case that matters to you (in regards to rock climbing etc)Overall I was surprisingly satisfied with this shoe model personally, but your mileage may vary.

Review.review: Love, Love my Adidas sneakers! Only issue I have with them is where the tongue attaches to the area at the top of the laces (closest to the toes), I have to shove my finger in to smooth it out before tying or it's uncomfortable. The sneaker itself is exactly as you’d expect, aesthetically speaking. HOWEVER, the INSOLE is unacceptable. How’re you going to advertise how comfortable your sneakers are but then fail to provide the insert that is assumed to be the source of the advertised comfort?The stitching (for my personal foot) ran under my 4th toe, meaning that my pinky toe technically wasn’t on the traced insert. The stitching used is obviously good quality, but is usually only seen if you lift the insert of the sneaker. But as stated before, there is no insert (imo) so now I’m expected to buy an additional product to accommodate what I thought would naturally just be a part of a sneaker to be purchased by me, the consumer. I did not realize that the cloud comfort foam is not meant to be directly felt by my feet, but rather an insert that is not included with the sneakers themselves, and must be purchased individually (that doesn’t even consider that “the right insert” might be hard to find for any multitude of reasons $).

The shoes are lightweight and look like the picture. My issue is the inner lining is weird near the toes. It’s like there is no padding under the toes. Honestly, it feels like these didn’t pass the quality assurance test to be “real” adidas.

I’m wondering if these were actually made by Adidas or if I got scammed as I have never had this poor of quality Adidas in my whole life. Disappointed.

title: adidas Originals Women's Terrex Tracefinder Trail Running Shoes

Review.review: Why did you pick this product vs others?:I chose these specifically for a Tough Mudder 15K. I needed something lightweight, trail-ready, and supportive enough for hours of running, climbing, and wading through deep mud — and they delivered big time.I absolutely adore these shoes. They held up through 15K of mud, water, obstacles, and nonstop movement. I was knee-deep in 2.5 feet of mud for much of the race, and not once did they slip, rub, or make my feet ache. The tread was fantastic for trail grip, and the arch support was just as good as what I get from my Danskos or Brooks — which I wear daily at my hospital job where I’m on my feet for 8+ hours.These didn’t just survive the course — they thrived on it. No blisters, no soreness, and they cleaned up surprisingly well post-race. Highly recommend for anyone doing obstacle races, trail runs, or just needing a solid, supportive shoe for long days.

The saving grace is that this shoe is not wide, so the narrow fitting allows me to wear with a bit more room in the toe.  But the 6 works just as well for the timing, fit. and the color match is spot on!!!
Cute and comfortable!

Now for the weird part: I was surprised to read all the comments saying how big these shoes run, but they are definitely a full size too big. I wear a 9 and sometimes 9.5, and I had to go down to an 8 and they fit perfectly. Strangely, the tag says the size US 8 is equivalent to size EU/FR 40 (which is actually a 9) and it seems that the true sizing aligns with the EU size that is listed on the tag rather than the US size.

The design and color looked very elegant and stylish to me and I ordered the size reading customer reviews.I usually wear 6.5 but I ordered the size 6.5 (wide ) to keep some extra space and flexibility between my fingers for extra comfort. The shoe was perfect to my size. Had great experience wearing them for 3-4 days for long hours. It has very soft cushioning and soft rubber soul which made the shoe very comfortable to wear.I stood on my foot for hours with great comfort..Worth paying for it..Would recommend everyone to buy.

I don’t write many reviews, but sometimes you have to. The sizing of these shoes is a joke. I ordered my regular 9.5 size after carefully following Adidas’ guidance: place a piece of paper on the floor against the wall, mark where your big toe hits, and find your size on the chart. Cool.They arrived last week, and they looked and fit like clown shoes. I hate returning items — more trucks on the road, more cardboard waste — but the shoes looked great, and I needed a new pair. So, I ordered a full size down, even though I’ve never been an 8.5 in my life.They arrived today, and again, they’re huge! Length, width — even the laces are double the length they should be. title: adidas Men's Terrex Free 2 Low Gtx Hiking Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these hiking shoes comfortable, well-made, and durable, with one customer noting they perform well on various terrains. They provide good support, with one review mentioning confidence on loose rocks and uneven surfaces, and offer great grip and traction. While some customers find them true to size, others report they run too big, and customers disagree on the weight.

Review.review: I am absolutely delighted with my new Adidas hiking shoes, which I purchased specifically for a recent hiking trip to Estes Park, Colorado. From the moment I laced them up, I knew these shoes were going to be a game-changer, and they certainly proved their worth on the challenging trails.My primary requirements for hiking footwear are comfort and support, and these Adidas shoes delivered outstandingly on both fronts. The cushioning provides excellent comfort, absorbing the impact of each step, while the robust construction offers superior ankle and arch support, which is crucial for long days on the trail. One small note on sizing: I found that the sizing was a bit off, and I actually had to size down to get the perfect fit.I put these shoes through an extensive test, hiking between 8 and 11 miles each day through the rugged and rocky terrain of Estes Park. Despite the demanding conditions, my feet remained comfortable and well-protected. There was no slipping, rubbing, or discomfort, even after many hours of continuous use. The grip on the soles was exceptional, providing confidence on loose rocks and uneven surfaces.These shoes truly stood up to the challenge, proving to be incredibly durable and reliable. They not only protected my feet from the harsh ground but also contributed significantly to my overall enjoyment and stamina during the hikes.Overall, if you're planning a hiking adventure, especially one involving rocky or demanding trails, I cannot recommend these Adidas hiking shoes highly enough. They offer a perfect blend of comfort, support, and durability, making them an indispensable companion for any serious hiker.

Per many other reviews these shoes run really large. I normally wear an eight or an 8 1/2 in hiking and running shoes. The first pair I bought were eights which I thought would be small enough. They were huge. I returned those for a 7 1/2. I have wide feet and even the 7 1/2 is a smidge large. I ran out of time for a trip and kept them instead of trying an even smaller size. I have plenty of room in the toe box. I can’t imagine these would work for anyone with narrow to maybe even moderately narrow feet. I also don’t have much arch. I wear Hoka Gaviotas- if you have those you’ll love these.  If you can find the right fit, these are very comfortable right out of the box and a great hiker. I hiked in Costa Rica in muddy and wet dirt and had zero issues. Grip and traction was great. There was no break-in needed-  no blisters or tired feet.  They cleaned up well. ( I do wish manufacturers would stop using white bottoms on hiking shoes. It’s a given you’ll be in brown dirt- why white?) I also wore these all day traveling and in airports. Seriously comfy shoe.  I wasn’t a fan of the green color in the 8.5 - they looked a little garish. I wish all manufacturers had more neutral, natural colors.  I went to black in the second pair and much preferred that look albeit they’re  a little boring. If you have feet like mine shoe shopping can be really frustrating. I went to REI and many other stores before giving up and going to Amazon. (Oddly I didn’t find Hoka hikers comfortable. Too much arch) I do think it’s worth trying to find the right size in these because in the end if you have wide flattish feet these are great for trails and even day to day. That’s why I gave them 5 stars.One note- the rear pull strap is quite high.  While it didn’t bother me a ton I can see how it might bother others.

These hiking shoes run larger than other brands, see my picture comparing them to several other brands I own that are the same size (size 8.) However, they are so comfy and my feet appreciated the extra room on my hike. My right foot typically can only stand a 45 minute hike before the ball of foot starts to throb and swell throbs. I took these out on a hour and 15 minute hike and only had mild pain. They performed very well on a variety of terrain. No slippage on sand, loose dirt, grass, or compact gravel, even in hills. There was minor slippage on loose rocksthat where about 1"-2" diameter when going downhill. The shoe also seemed to give my weak ankles more support. There was one point where I slipped slightly and felt my ankle wanted to turn, however the shoe prevented it. My old hiking shoes don't come up high enough on the ankle and my foot would have turned over for sure. If you're someone who has feet that ache and seem to swell when you hike, I would recommend sticking to your normal size. Otherwise you might want to size down. Personally, I'm glad they run a little big so my toes don't press against the shoe, which always seemed to happen when I'd walk down hills. My feet didn't seem to slide around in the extra room like I was worried they would either.

I like and wear a roomier size 8 in my Brooks running shoes but usually do a 7.5 in many other shoes. I bought the 7.5 for these after reading reviews about size. They were too big and I had to send back to get a 7. They are insanely comfortable and a perfect trail shoe when hiking boots are too much but tennis shoes aren’t quite enough. These are more comfortable than typical trail running shoes and are a bit heavier. They have as good as or better traction and grip than other similar shoes (way more than OnClouds and about the same as Altra). They have a wide toe box and thick sole padding. They’re a great hiking shoe or for walking off road or in mud and rain, as they’re waterproof. Love them! They do look a little bulky on, so if that bothers you, you may want to look elsewhere.

The light blue and orange shoes are not water proof . The other options that have Gor Tex labeled on the shoe are . The light blue are comfortable and true to size . I had to return mine due to them not being waterproof.

Review.review: Fantastic shoes. I wore these over a 12day trip through Europe and my feet were comfortable all day walking on cobblestone streets, whether the weather was warm or cool and drizzling.

I am always hesitant to buy shoes online due to problems with sizing, but these seem to be sized accurately. I have three other pairs of Adidas running shoes, two of them being 11's and one being 10.5. I also measured my heel to toe length and got between 10.5 and 11 inches, depending on if I am putting any weight on my foot or not. Based on this, I thought buying size 11 would be a safe bet. Once I put them on, I noticed the fabric above my big toe was a little tight when wearing them with socks on the thicker side, but not too uncomfortable. This may change as the insoles wear in. I was expecting there to be more room width-wise due to reviews stating that the shoes were very wide, but I did not find this to be the case. They seem to be on par with my other shoes, and I don't own any 'wide' sized shoes, but YMMV. If you are going purely off of the size chart, I would probably order a half to full size larger, but you can always return them and get another size. Overall, I like the shoes and will be ordering another pair, in size 11.5 this time, for when these wear out one day.

Review.review: These are my favorite shoes right now. They are comfortable and hold up well throughout the day. I get the men’s because they seem wider and more supportive than the women’s.

I've been wearing these shoes since I believe October 2023 (a few days after total hip replacement surgery). Other then being more dirty, they are still just as comfortable with everything in perfect condition more than a year later. I did research on good shoes for after the surgery and what is good to have, and for someone my age it mainly just seemed like having something with cushion and such that you didn't fall was most important.These shoes look great - I chose the black color as they're a bit more muted to suit my personal preference. These are wider with the soles which took a little bit of remeasuring to get used to when walking the first couple times, but then it was an afterthought. The cushioning is amazing! These are super comfortable. I've always been athletic until pretty much COVID, then the hip issue, and I've loved the Adidas brand, so have been perfect!These helped through the initial post-surgery steps, through physical therapy, through regaining my strength, and now with regular daily walking and whatnot.Definitely not waterproof, but perhaps waterproofing spray may help a bit. I live in the PNW so it rains when it's not the other season, but it hasn't bothered me yet.Bottom-line: Well-worth the purchase, definitely great for rehabilitation purposes, great for walking and stability.

This is my second pair of these shoes. I bought the first pair two years ago to take on a vacation to France and they were so good that this year I bought another pair, for you guessed it, another European vacation. What initially attracted me to these is that they are subtle yet comfortable. Yes, you can wear whatever shoes you want but in Europe, people tend to dress better, and their shoes are less flamboyant but still comfortable for hours and miles of walking. The purple is very subdued, and I have no problem wearing these just about anywhere. They're an ideal travel shoe because they are lightweight, breathable and supportive, all while being a fantastic value for the price. The name Ultrabounce conjures up thoughts of springy marshmallow comfort. I would say that's not entirely accurate. Yes, the shoes are comfortable but they are not crazy soft (like Hoka or some of the other super cushioned options out there)  and I think that's a good thing; they're cushioned enough to be comfortable but supportive enough to take care of your feet. What I also like about them is the way they fit. I have notoriously difficult feet to fit; I have narrow feet with high arches. While many companies are embracing the wider is better, especially in the toebox, these Adidas Ultrabounce runners have a welcomed medium to slightly narrow fit, perfect for me. In terms of size, I wear a size 12 in Nike and Asics; an 11.5 in Brooks and the 11.5 in these fit me perfectly. So why only 4 stars? I'm being picky, the insole is very basic and could do with more arch support; also, and this is a small thing, the laces are really long, they could be a little shorter. I worry that these will be discontinued, which would be a shame since they've become my go-to travel shoe and I bet that most people will appreciate them too. Buy them if you still can!

I do regular walks for my health, and normally use basketball sneakers because shoes in my size are rare. I wear a 17 US Mens, and that is not often found in other sneakers. Adidas actually made these in big sizes! I found no defects in the construction, or material of the shoes. The fit is very good, the ankle support is not there is you plan on using these for cross training. However when it comes to walking they are great. They are extremely light, I mean lighter than canvas sneakers while at the same time providing a lot more cushion. If you are not used to these types of walking shoes it does take a little bit of time to get used to. It literally feels like you are walking on a memory foam mattress at first. After a couple of days I started to break them in. They feel great on asphalt, concrete, gravel, and even some uneven terrain. The price was reasonable when compared to other walking shoes with similar padding and construction. If you want to take up walking I would recommend this pair.

These shoes fit true to size and have impressively held up over nearly three weeks of wear. They remain as comfortable as the first time I put them on. What's remarkable is that I don't even need to use inserts, which is quite rare for me due to my hubby's flat feet and other foot issues.Additionally, they resist showing dirt... after wearing them in dusty conditions, they wipe clean effortlessly. I am not sure about the lights, as I chose the ones without the lights.Having learned the importance of investing in high~quality shoes for good foot health due to past issues, I can confidently say that these shoes are a fantastic value. I truly love this brand, and these shoes exemplify the quality and comfort that make them worth every penny!

When wearing no-show socks, the back of the sneaker rubs against the back of my foot and starts to get uncomfortable.  I am comparing these to a similar running show I have from Mizuno and I like the other one better due to the better shoelace design and lower rise on the back.  Overall though, this is a very good sneaker.

I do like the look of them on him, very cool on a eleven year old. They have a nice wide heel with good stability which is good since he has some pronation in his feet. Also he doesn't often wear sandals because of his pronation, so occasionally wears sneakers without socks in the summer. These are so scratchy inside that would not be comfortable with these. In the end these feel like a mid-quality shoe, but with good sole and support. The top feels a bit lower quality, and very scratchy. Our main problem is with sizing, running a full side smaller then expected, and a bit narrow.

So I went down a rabbit hole to look for the PERFECT everyday sneaker and something that's robust and inexpensive as well. And let me tell you if you can find the right size for this shoe, it's well worth the hassle if the shoe FITS.Fit & Sizing:Now in terms of fit I unfortunately had to try THREE different sizing, to summarize- I'm normally a UK 9 (US9.5), and I saw reviews to size up but it was WAY too big for me, then ordered a size US9.5 which was OKAY, but I did the shove toes to the front of the toe box while seeing how many fingers I can put into the heel.. And it was 2 fingers (supposed to be 1 finger snugly). I tested it out walking for a whole day for about 4 miles walk and I didn't feel any fatigue from that. But the fit just felt a little off, that the heel still felt loose. I could still fit 2 fingers when doing that test. So finally I ordered a size US8.5 and YES it fits, BUT the joint above the toes (Metatarsal area) feels a little bit tight at the moment.I will update this review if it breaks in well and whether I was a lunatic to not stick with my true size. Will break in and update.Breathability:Shoes are fairly breathable. It is by no means a jogging shoe like running shoes but it's not suffocating. I'm hoping that this will be an all season shoe for me and this feels like a good balance  for this fall and hopefully the winter.Color:Ultimate dad shoe vibes- love the 90s classic aesthetic and texture (I got the Cloud White/Charcoal/Putty Grey), I'm happy this will pair with my minimalist outfits and I enjoy the simplicity of this colorway. If you're a uniqlo fan this shoe fits the bill pretty well with a lot of fits.Additional notes/Durability:Do note that I really went in the deep end to discover and research the perfect shoe not just for everyday use but also using this for occasional hikes too- because the sole is lugged (4.5mm) and it should be good for casual, occasional hikes. And also Adidas has a partnership with Continental I can attest from another a pair of Ultra Boost that these soles last a very long time. So it's amazing in terms of value- just behind VIBRAM but the shoes that have that technology tends to be a lot more expensive depending on model, around 100-200usd and above (like Hoka pricing). So I expect this shoe to last a long time.Conclusion:Don't sleep on this model, it's very underrated right now especially if it's on sale. Try it and be wary of the sizing problems. I'd say go for your true size and be prepared to go a size down, and disclaimer that everyone's feet is different.

Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes to be of good quality and worth their price. Review.review: Great shoe - not sure if I would label this a running shoe...maybe a walking shoe.  Casual.  I normally fit 10.5 and needed to get an 11, but worth the price.

Shoe fits great. It does hug the middle of your foot, so if you have wide feet, maybe go wide or something different. They feel great for awhile but long walks, like mall shopping or tourist trips are not recommended. After awhile your feet will start to hurt and you can’t wait to take them off.

I have narrow feet and heels usually have problems with shoes coming loose at the heel and ankle area. I purchased these based on some of the reviews that stated that these shoes ran small/narrow. The problem is that the elastic appearing band at the arch of the shoe is actually not elastic and appears to be more of a cosmetic touch. Even with my narrow feet, I had problems getting my foot into the shoe without a fair amount of effort assisted by a shoe horn. The band is relatively rigid and places a great deal of constriction in the midfoot area and along the inner arch of the foot. Once my foot is in the shoe, this constriction is very obvious and yet the heel/ankle area remain loose. This is a very non-anatomically sized shoe. The length appears to be true to fit, its just this midfoot band that is extremely uncomfortable. Also, the sole of this shoe is very stiff. It is not at all flexible unlike what you would normally expect in a casual slip on shoe. I was very disappointed as I liked the cosmetics of the shoe. Unfortunately, I have to say that this is one of the most uncomfortable shoes that I have ever purchased. I should have heeded the negative reviews that talked about how uncomfortable these shoes are. I just thought that it was because people had purchased the wrong size shoe. However, it is the construction and design of the shoe that makes it ill-fitting and uncomfortable. Perhaps that is why they are discounted so much. I have owned several pair of Adidas shoes (in the past they tended to fit well as they tended to accommodate narrower feet like mine). However, this is the first Adidas shoe style that I could not wear (in the proper 8.5 size) due to extreme discomfort. Again, quit a disappointment as I thought that I could snag a “deal” as I really liked the sleek and clean look of the shoe. Will definitely be returning after just trying them on for 3-5 minutes.

title: adidas Men's Grand Court 2.0 Tennis Shoe
Customer_say: Customers praise these tennis shoes for their top-notch quality, classic Adidas style, and good value for money. The shoes are comfortable, with one customer noting they fit well under the arch of the foot, and feature a soft leather build with amazing cushioning. While some customers report the shoes hold up well, others mention issues with stitching coming apart. The fit receives mixed feedback, with some finding it true to size while others say it runs half a size too small.

Review.review: I normally don’t gush over tennis shoes, but the adidas Grand Court 2.0 just forced me to. From style to comfort to sturdiness, these deliver everything you could want—and more—for the price.✅ Sleek, Classic LookThese deliver an effortlessly clean, old-school tennis style that works in nearly any casual or sporty setting. The iconic 3‑Stripes and crisp white leather pop beautifully. I’ve gotten multiple compliments already—people assume I spent way more.✅ Instant Comfort & SupportNo break-in needed—these felt great from day one. The padded collar gives serious ankle support, while the OrthoLite® sockliner molds perfectly to your foot and helps manage sweat. Even after full days of running and walking, my feet feel fresh and supported.✅ Reliable Build QualityThe synthetic leather upper is durable and wipes clean easily—no peeling or fraying even after daily wear. The rubber cupsole balances firmness and flexibility, offering traction and durability all week long.✅ Versatile & Easy to StylePerfect for casual Fridays, weekend errands, or hitting the court. I pair mine effortlessly with both jeans and activewear, and they just blend in. Also, despite the name, I find these great for everyday walking too.Bottom Line:Whether you’re buying these as an entry-level sneaker or supplement to your athletic rotation, the Grand Court 2.0 is an absolute win for style, comfort, and build, all at a great price.Bonus for adidas:If you’re looking for a detail-oriented reviewer who loves honest feedback and product testing, I’d be thrilled to help review more from your lineup in exchange for early access or testing units 😄.Bottom line: Five stars — I’ll definitely be back for more colors and maybe a backup pair.
Nice. All soft leather, old school style and colors, comfortable and light. Budget friendly pricing and fast delivery.Very pleased with my purchase.

If you're thinking about getting them, don’t hesitate — you’re going to love them!

Review.review: These shoes have been a hit in our house! My kiddo absolutely loves them and wears them every day — whether it’s for school, the playground, or just running around outside. I also really like the chunky rubber outsole — not only does it look stylish, but it gives excellent grip, even on slick surfaces.I also appreciate that they’re made with recycled materials — it’s a small but meaningful step in the right direction. Definitely recommend if you’re looking for a durable, comfy, and eco-friendly pair of kids’ shoes!

These shoes are a hybrid between traditional and slip on design.  There’s no shoe tongue.  Instead, it’s made of elastic cool material that stretches when you insert your feet into them.  There’s a flap that has laces like traditional shoes so you can further tighten them if it’s still loose.  My daughter loves the fun girly color and says they’re very comfortable.  The size runs slightly big so order down if your kids have smaller feet.Now for the not so good. The sole is more plasticky than grippy rubber.  I compare every shoes to Merrell since I consider them the benchmark.  Merrell use super soft grippy rubber soles.  In my opinion, it’s not the best value for your money at $70.  Cross shop and consider Merrell as an alternative.
My son said these are the most comfortable shoes!

I ordered these Adidas Captor Flow 2.0 sneakers for my 10 year old niece knowing that school will be starting next month and she will want a new pair of sneakers. There are several color combos to order from and I debated about ordering the white with the fluorescent pink and yellow but white sneakers get so dirty and I knew they would be dirty in a week so I opted for the gray with purple combo.These sneakers are a tight knit, breathable mesh and the shoe is in one piece, no tongue, with man made leather eyestays with purple loops and tie laces. There is a high heel tab which makes putting them on a little easier although I have a pair of Adidas shoes with the high tab in the back and I needed to buy heel tab socks to prevent rubbing on the top of my heel, she wear ankle socks so it shouldn’t be a problem. There is also a heel reinforcement as well as an extra rubber tab at the toes although she is rough on sneakers so I am not sure these will help. The inner sole is their patented Cloudfoam for cushioning and these shoes have a decent arch as well. The sole is white with a touch of purple to match the shoes and it’s constructed of the typical foam soles you find in most sneakers these days, it feels hollow but it’s a lightweight synthetic foam rubber.These shoes are nicely constructed and my niece really likes the style of this shoe, it’s current and she even likes the grey and purple color combo  (she usually almost always picks out pink!). The price point is about average for brand name kids sneakers but these Kaptir Flow 2.0 sneakers are nice quality and my niece said they are super comfortable so the price is a good value. Overall, she gave them two thumbs up!
